edu.lehigh.cse.lol

Class Enemy

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.lehigh.cse.lol.Actor
      • edu.lehigh.cse.lol.Enemy

  • public class Enemy
extends Actor
    Enemies are things to be avoided or defeated by the hero. Every enemy can be defeated via projectiles. They can also be defeated by colliding with invincible heroes, or by colliding with a hero whose strength is >= the enemy's damage, though that case results in the hero losing strength. A level can require all enemies to be defeated before the level can be won. Note that Enemies can move in a variety of ways

      • makeAsBox

        public static Enemy makeAsBox(float x,
                              float y,
                              float width,
                              float height,
                              java.lang.String imgName)
        Make an enemy that has an underlying rectangular shape.
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom right corner
        width - The width of the enemy
        height - The height of the enemy
        imgName - The name of the image to display
        Returns:
        The enemy, so that it can be modified further

      • makeAsPolygon

        public static Enemy makeAsPolygon(float x,
                                  float y,
                                  float width,
                                  float height,
                                  java.lang.String imgName,
                                  float... verts)
        Draw an enemy with an underlying polygon shape
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of the bottom left corner
        y - Y coordinate of the bottom left corner
        width - Width of the obstacle
        height - Height of the obstacle
        imgName - Name of image file to use
        verts - Up to 16 coordinates representing the vertexes of this polygon, listed as x0,y0,x1,y1,x2,y2,...
        Returns:
        The enemy, so that it can be further modified

      • setDamage

        public void setDamage(int amount)
        Set the amount of damage that this enemy does to a hero
        Parameters:
        amount - Amount of damage. Default is 2, since heroes have a default strength of 1, so that the enemy defeats the hero but does not disappear.
